entry.title: Solving `punycode` DeprecationWarning in Hexo
entry.content:
Introduction

I started seeing punycode DeprecationWarnings whenever I served or deployed my Hexo blog from some time:

(node:39714) [DEP0040] DeprecationWarning: The `punycode` module is deprecated. Please use a userland alternative instead.

After some digging, I found that this issue occurs when using Node.js version 21. I wasn‚Äôt keen on downgrading, so I fought my way through and managed to resolve it.

Conclusion

Long story short, the issue was caused by outdated dependencies in some plugins used in my Hexo.

  • [Case 1] A manually created package had an outdated devDependency

    • [Solution 1-1] Update the dependencies manually in the package‚Äôs package.json
    • [Solution 1-2] If devDependencies are unnecessary, remove them entirely
    EX) A customized hexo-generator-searchdb plugin

    [Case]

    • I had made several modifications to my blog‚Äôs setup to support a bilingual (English/Korean) environment. One of these tweaks was modifying the search.xml generation to store the post‚Äôs language, and use it for search.
      If the current site language is Korean, Korean-written posts have highest search priority.

    • To achieve this, I copied the entire hexo-generator-searchdb source code into source/js/ and used it as a local package under the name hexo-generator-searchdb-custom.
      Then change the package setting like this:

    [Problem]

    • The problem was that running npm install also installed devDependencies of the local package.
      • IDK why, but the default --production flag which prevents devDependencies from being installed when using external packages didn‚Äôt seem to apply to local packages.
      • Anywhy, this package included eslint@7.32.0, which still used punycode in the old fashion.

    [Solution]

    • Since I didn‚Äôt actually need the devDependencies, I simply deleted them all from the local package.

    • Alternatively, I could have updated hexo-generator-searchdb-custom/package.json as follows:

  • [Case 2] An outdated package in dependencies within installed package

    • [Solution 2-1] Use override to enforce a newer dependency version
    • [Solution 2-2] Modify the punycode-related code in node_modules
      Not ideal, but sometimes there's no other way...
    EX) hexo-renderer-markdown-it plugin

    [Case]

    • Right now, my blog renders Markdown using the hexo-renderer-markdown-it plugin.
      • Since I use KaTex for math rendering, this plugin is recommended over the default hexo-renderer-markdown[1].
    • And the hexo-renderer-markdown-it plugin uses markdown-it@13.0.2.

    [Problem]

    • markdown-it@13.0.2 loads punycode in old way:

      • Instead of const punycode = require('punycode'), it should use
        const punycode = require('punycode/')[2].

    • Thus I should override the dependency to a newer version, or update the punycode-related code in node_modules by myself.

    • The real problem was that updating markdown-it to version 14.0.0+ broke hexo-renderer-markdown-it‚Ä¶ I didn't want to spend time fixing it.. bc I've never studied Node.js...;-;


      [Solution]

    • So I manually edited node_modules/hexo-renderer-markdown-it/node_modules/markdown-it/lib/index.js:

      • What is the authors feeling when the problem solved only with a single slash? (1000)
      • Since the above code use punycode in node_modules, you‚Äôll need to run npm install punycode --save if you haven‚Äôt already.

    • To avoid manually editing it every time, you can automate it using a postinstall script (see below).

How I Got Resolved

The conclusion is just a conclusion, and I‚Äôm sure that most will get the deprecation issue from the other packages. Therefore, I wrote down the process of how I solved the problem in the stream of consciousness.

Check Status

If I remember correctly, the first thing I did was to check the version of Node.js.

Downgrading might have fixed it, but my pride wouldn‚Äôt allow it.
(Not at all actually. I just thought the latter will be better since I don‚Äôt have any knowledge about the difference between v20 and v21 in Node.js)

punycode vs. punycode/

Googling ‚Äúnpm punycode deprecation‚Äù and so on led me to realize that some packages that use punycode cause the warning due to the old way of importing it.

So, if you read the punycode GitHub readme[2:1], it roughly says:

  1. Install punycode
  2. Use require('punycode/'), not require('punycode')

to avoid the warning.
Honestly, the two lines aren‚Äôt that different in my eyes. I just thought as they‚Äôre similar to a gap between from.utils import * and from.utils import * in python. Then I skipped it. haha

punycode dependency

Anyway, for that reason, I tried to find all modules that use punycode in my project. Let‚Äôs go to the root directory and look for the inheritance of the punycode with npm ls punycode.

I roughly got those results. (I don‚Äôt remember the exact version numbers)

As you can see, hexo-generator-searchdb-custom that uses eslint that uses uri-js that uses punycode was the problem. lol

Since I already had found lots of googling results about eslint, ajv, or uri-js packages, I also runned npm ls [package-name] for them to find the punycode dependency.

In sum, I found the old-versioned eslint dependency in two packages:

  • hexo-generator-searchdb-custom
  • hexo-generator-sitemap-custom

Fix (1)

At first, I opened the package.json of each package because I thought I could update the versions of these packages to the latest. But what I found was that both of them had eslint as a devDependencies, not dependencies.

As you can imagine from its name, both packages are the local packages that I customized from the original plugins. I had to fix almost all of the existing packages overall, so I just replicated them locally, modified them, and used them as below, and that caused the problem.

IDK why but when I run npm install, it also installed the devDependencies of the local package.

  • I guess the --production option of npm install doesn‚Äôt work for local packages.
  • Gave up on finding the exact reason nor the proper solution

I didn‚Äôt actually need the devDependencies since I just copied the original package for convenience. So I just deleted devDependencies inside package.json from each local package.

Then run below commands to reinstall whole packages:

Fix (2)

I thought it would be solved then‚Ä¶ but Warning appeared again, and I was about to throw my laptop away for real since it took me two days until here‚Ä¶

So I just emptied my mind and decided to find all js files that use punycode with find command.
its quite ignorant, but I didn‚Äôt have any other ideas:D

In the middle of bunch of results, there was a code like this:
./hexo-renderer-markdown-it/node_modules/markdown-it/lib/index.js: var punycode = require('punycode');
x
Since I found one, I opened the file with the intention of modifying it one by one from here.

The file lib/index.js of markdown-it@13.0.2 installed inside hexo-renderer-markdown-it seemed to use punycode the old way.

So I just add a slash to the end and saved it:

Then I ran hexo server -o again, and this time, it said punycode is not installed.
This is because punycode/ implies the punycode in the node_modules, so I installed it with npm i punycode --save.

Finally, I ran the server again, and the DeprecationWarning didn‚Äôt appear anymore.

Phew! I don‚Äôt have to throw my laptop away anymore!

Postinstall Script

By the way, modifying the code in node_modules was a bit annoying, and also was not seem to be a good practice. So I searched a little and soon found the usage of postinstall script.

It is reallllllly simple.

  1. Install the patch-package package.

  2. Find the code that you want to fix in node_modules and fix it.

    • Already fixed, so skip

  3. Add the postinstall script to package.json.

  4. Save the modified file as a patch

    Caution) Since I modified the package inside the package, if I run npx patch-package hexo-renderer-markdown-it, a message saying that ‚ÅâÔ∏è There don't appear to be any changes. will appear.
    In this case, you should run something like npx patch-package hexo-renderer-markdown-it/markdown-it instead.

  5. Done!

    • During the 4, the patch file will be created in patches directory.
    • Now you don‚Äôt need to manually modify it anymore since the patches in that folder will be applied automatically when you run npm install.

P.S.

  • Can‚Äôt believe to had such a long and hard time just for a single warning message‚Ä¶ I really shouldn‚Äôt dig up Node.js. No talent.ü´†
  • I also tried the ‚Äúoverrides‚Äù method to update the markdown-it version later, but it didn‚Äôt work. It‚Äôll be good to try overriding since the method is really easy[3].

  1. Butterfly document - Theme Configuration # Math (link) ‚Ü©Ô∏é

  2. Github - mathiasbynens/punycode.js (link) ‚Ü©Ô∏é ‚Ü©Ô∏é

  3. npm Docs - package.json (link) ‚Ü©Ô∏é

entry.title: Hello World
entry.content:
This post is the first post generated when you run $ hexo init command.
You can find the original source code from hexojs/hexo-starter.[1]

Introduction

Welcome to Hexo! This is your very first post. Check documentation for more info. If you get any problems when using Hexo, you can find the answer in troubleshooting or you can ask me on GitHub.

Quick Start

More info: Writing

Run server

More info: Deployment

entry.title: KaTeX Test Code
entry.content:
Introduction

Why KaTeX

  • KaTeX\KaTeXKATE‚ÄãX is a fast, easy-to-use JavaScript library for TeX math rendering on the web.
  • hexo-theme-butterfly recommends to use KaTeX rather than MathJax for better performance.
  • KaTex supports copy and paste of the rendered math expressions.

Reference

  • All the #Supported Functions content is copied from upupming‚Äôs blog[1][2].
  • The auther[1:1] states that this is the revised version of the original content from KaTeX Supported Functions[3].

Note

  • I made some changes to the original content[2:1]
    • Change #Macros, #HTML, and #Color section to avoid the conflict with markdown syntax. Read the note block for more information in each section.
    • Change some expressions according to the KaTeX official site[3:1].
    • Add some expressions that is not included in the original content[2:2].
      Probably because the upgraded KaTex Documentation was not reflected.

Unicode

The letters listed above will render in any KaTeX rendering mode.

If the KaTeX rendering mode is set to strict: false or strict:"warn" (default), then KaTeX will accept all Unicode letters. The letters not listed above will be rendered from system fonts, not KaTeX-supplied fonts, so their typography may clash. They may also cause small vertical alignment issues. KaTeX has detailed metrics for glyphs in Latin, Greek, and Cyrillic, but other glyphs are treated as if they are each as tall as the letter M.

For Persian composite characters, a user-supplied plug-in is under development.

Line Breaks

KaTeX 0.10.0+ will insert automatic line breaks in inline math after relations or binary operators such as ‚Äú=‚Äù or ‚Äú+‚Äù. These can be suppressed by \nobreak or by placing math inside a pair of braces, as in {F=ma}. \allowbreak will allow automatic line breaks at locations other than relations or operators.

Hard line breaks are \\ and \newline.

In display math, KaTeX does not insert automatic line breaks. It ignores display math hard line breaks when rendering option strict: true.

Macros

There shold be a space between { and # to avoid the conflict with the markdown syntax.
OR use {% raw %} and {% endraw %} to avoid the conflict.

  • $\gdef\bar#1{#1^2} \bar{x} + \bar{y}$ (X)
  • $\gdef\bar#1{ #1^2} \bar{x} + \bar{y}$ (O)
  • {% raw %}$\gdef\bar#1{#1^2} \bar{x} + \bar{y}${% endraw %} (O)
x2+x2\def\foo{x^2} \foo + \foox2+x2 \def\foo{x^2} \foo + \foo

\global\def\macroname#1#2‚Ä¶{definition}
\newcommand\macroname[numargs]{definition}
\renewcommand\macroname[numargs]{definition}
\providecommand\macroname[numargs]{definition}

Macros can also be defined in the KaTeX rendering options.

Macros accept up to nine arguments: #1, #2, etc.

\gdef and \global\def macros will persist between math expressions.

Available functions include:

@ is a valid character for commands, as if \makeatletter were in effect.

Color

Using # inside $$ will cause a conflict with the markdown syntax.
To avoid this, use six-digit CSS hexadecimal style without the #, OR use {% raw %} and {% endraw %} tags.

  • $\textcolor{#FF0000}{F=ma}$ (X)
  • $\textcolor{FF0000}{F=ma}$ (O)
  • {% raw %}$\textcolor{#FF0000}{F=ma}${% endraw %} (O)

Using $ inside $$ will cause a conflict with the markdown syntax. To avoid this, use \textit{} instead of $‚Ä¶$.

  • $\textcolor{red}{$F=ma$}$ (X)
  • $\textcolor{red}{\textit{F=ma}}$ (O)

F=ma\color{blue} F=maF=ma \color{blue} F=ma

Note that KaTeX \color acts like a switch. This aligns with LaTeX and differs from MathJax.
Other KaTeX color functions expect the content to be a function argument:

F=ma\textcolor{blue}{F=ma}F=ma \textcolor{blue}{F=ma}

F=ma\textcolor{228B22}{F=ma}F=ma \textcolor{228B22}{F=ma}

F=ma\colorbox{aqua}{\textit{F=ma}}F=ma‚Äã \colorbox{aqua}{\textit{F=ma}}

F=ma\fcolorbox{red}{aqua}{\textit{F=ma}}F=ma‚Äã \fcolorbox{red}{aqua}{\textit{F=ma}}

For color definition, KaTeX color functions will accept the standard HTML predefined color names. They will also accept an RGB argument in CSS hexa¬≠decimal style. The ‚Äú#‚Äù is optional before a six-digit specification.

Units

In KaTeX, units are proportioned as they are in TeX.

KaTeX units are different than CSS units.

KaTeX Unit Value KaTeX Unit Value
em CSS em bp 1/72‚Äã inch √ó F √ó G
ex CSS ex pc 12 KaTeX pt
mu 1/18 CSS em dd 1238/1157‚Äã KaTeX pt
pt 1/72.27 inch √ó F √ó G cc 14856/1157 KaTeX pt
mm 1 mm √ó F √ó G nd 685/642 KaTeX pt
cm 1 cm √ó F √ó G nc 1370/107‚Äã KaTeX pt
in 1 inch √ó F √ó G sp 1/65536 KaTeX pt

where:

F = (font size of surrounding HTML text)/(10 pt)

G = 1.21 by default, because KaTeX font-size is normally 1.21 √ó the surrounding font size. This value can be overridden by the CSS of an HTML page.

The effect of style and size:

Unit textstyle scriptscript huge
em or ex \rule{1em}{1em} \scriptscriptstyle\rule{1em}{1em} \huge\rule{1em}{1em}
mu \rule{18mu}{18mu} \scriptscriptstyle\rule{18mu}{18mu} \huge\rule{18mu}{18mu}
others \rule{10pt}{10pt} \scriptscriptstyle\rule{10pt}{10pt} \huge\rule{10pt}{10pt}

      Í∑∏ Ï§ë ÌïòÎÇòÍ∞Ä search.xml ÏÉùÏÑ± ÏãúÏóê Ìï¥Îãπ Ìè¨Ïä§ÌåÖÏùò Ïñ∏Ïñ¥Î•º Ìï®Íªò Ï†ÄÏû•ÌïòÏó¨ Í≤ÄÏÉâÏóê ÌôúÏö©ÌïòÎäî Í≤ÉÏù¥ÏóàÏùå

      • --production ÏòµÏÖòÏù¥ ÎîîÌè¥Ìä∏ÎùºÏÑú Ïô∏Î∂Ä Ìå®ÌÇ§ÏßÄÎ•º ÏÇ¨Ïö©Ìï† ÎïåÎäî devDependencyÍ∞Ä ÏÑ§ÏπòÎêòÏßÄ ÏïäÎäîÎç∞, Î°úÏª¨ Ìå®ÌÇ§ÏßÄÎ•º ÏÇ¨Ïö©Ìï† ÎïåÎäî Ïôú Ïù¥ ÏòµÏÖòÏù¥ Ï†ÅÏö©ÎêòÏßÄ ÏïäÎäîÏßÄ Ïûò Î™®Î•¥Í≤†Ïùå
      • ÏïîÌäº Ïù¥ devDependencyÏóê eslint@7.32.0Í∞Ä Ìè¨Ìï®ÎêòÏñ¥ ÏûàÏóàÎäîÎç∞, Ïù¥Í≤å punycodeÎ•º ÏòàÏ†Ñ Î∞©ÏãùÏúºÎ°ú ÏÇ¨Ïö©ÌïòÍ≥† ÏûàÎäî Í≤É

  • [ÏÉÅÌô©2] Î∂àÎü¨Ïò® Ìå®ÌÇ§ÏßÄÏùò dependencies Ï§ë Ïò§ÎûòÎêú Î≤ÑÏ†ÑÏù¥ Ï°¥Ïû¨ÌïòÏó¨ Ïù¥Ïäà Î∞úÏÉù

    • [Ìï¥Í≤∞Î∞©Î≤ï2-1] override ÌôúÏö©ÌïòÏó¨ ÏùòÏ°¥ÏÑ± Ï†ïÎ≥¥Î•º ÏµúÏã†ÏúºÎ°ú ÎçÆÏñ¥ÏîåÏö∞Í∏∞
    • [Ìï¥Í≤∞Î∞©Î≤ï2-2] node_modules ÎÇ¥ÏóêÏÑú ÏßÅÏ†ë punycode Í¥ÄÎ†® ÏΩîÎìúÎ•º ÏàòÏ†ï
      Í∂åÏû•ÎêòÏßÄ ÏïäÎäîÎã§Îäî Í±¥ ÏïåÏßÄÎßå, Îã¨Î¶¨ Î∞©Î≤ïÏù¥ ÏóÜÏùÑ Îïê Ïñ¥Ï©î Ïàò ÏóÜÏúºÎãàÍπå..
    ÏòàÏãú) hexo-renderer-markdown-it ÌîåÎü¨Í∑∏Ïù∏

    [ÏÉÅÌô©]

      • Ïù¥ Î∏îÎ°úÍ∑∏ÏóêÏÑúÎäî KaTexÎ°ú ÏàòÏãùÏùÑ Î†åÎçîÎßÅÌïòÍ≥† ÏûàÎäîÎç∞,
        KaTex ÏÇ¨Ïö© ÏãúÏóêÎäî hexo-renderer-markdown-itÏùÑ Í∂åÏû•ÌïúÎã§[1]Í≥† ÌïòÏó¨
        HexoÏóêÏÑú Í∏∞Î≥∏ÏúºÎ°ú Ï†úÍ≥µÌïòÎäî hexo-renderer-markdown ÌîåÎü¨Í∑∏Ïù∏ ÎåÄÏã† ÏÇ¨Ïö© Ï§ë
    • Í∑∏Î¶¨Í≥† Ïù¥ hexo-renderer-markdown-it ÌîåÎü¨Í∑∏Ïù∏ÏóêÏÑú markdown-it@13.0.2Î•º ÏÇ¨Ïö©ÌïòÍ≥† ÏûàÏùå

    [Î¨∏Ï†ú]

    • Î¨∏Ï†úÎäî Ïù¥ markdown-it@13.0.2ÏóêÏÑú punycodeÎ•º ÏòàÏ†Ñ Î∞©ÏãùÏúºÎ°ú Î∂àÎü¨Ïò§Í≥† ÏûàÏùå
      • const punycode = require('punycode')Í∞Ä ÏïÑÎãå
        const punycode = require('punycode/')Î°ú Î∂àÎü¨ÏôÄÏïº Ìï®[2]
    • Îî∞ÎùºÏÑú Î≤ÑÏ†ÑÏùÑ Ïò§Î≤ÑÎùºÏù¥Îî©ÌïòÍ±∞ÎÇò ÏßÅÏ†ë Ìï¥Îãπ ÏΩîÎìúÎ•º ÏàòÏ†ïÌï¥Ïïº Ìï®
    • ÏßÑÏßú Î¨∏Ï†úÎäî markdown-itÏùÑ 14.0.0 Ïù¥ÏÉÅÏúºÎ°ú Ïò¨Î¶¨Î©¥ Í∑∏ÎÉ• hexo-renderer-markdown-it ÏûêÏ≤¥Í∞Ä ÎèåÏïÑÍ∞ÄÏßÄ ÏïäÏïÑ Ïò§Î≤ÑÎùºÏù¥Îî©Ïù¥ Î∂àÍ∞ÄÎä•ÌïòÎã§Îäî Í≤É‚Ä¶ Í∑∏Í±∞ÍπåÏßÄ Ìï¥Í≤∞ÌïòÍ≥† Ïã∂ÏßÑ ÏïäÏïòÏùå.. ÎÇú Node.js Í≥µÎ∂ÄÌï¥Î≥∏ Ï†Å ÏóÜÎäî Í±∏..

    [Ìï¥Í≤∞]

    • Îî∞ÎùºÏÑú, Ïñ¥Ï©î Ïàò ÏóÜÏù¥ node_modules/hexo-renderer-markdown-it/ ÏïàÏóê ÏûàÎäî node_modules/markdown-it/lib/index.jsÏùÑ ÏïÑÎûòÏôÄ Í∞ôÏù¥ ÏàòÏ†ïÌï®

      • Ïä¨ÎûòÏãú ÌïòÎÇò Ï∂îÍ∞ÄÌñàÏùÑ ÎøêÏù∏Îç∞ Î¨∏Ï†úÍ∞Ä Ìï¥Í≤∞ÎêòÏóàÏùÑ ÎïåÏùò Í∏∞Î∂ÑÏùÑ ÏÑúÏà†ÌïòÏãúÏò§. (1000Ï†ê)
      • Ïù¥Î†áÍ≤å ÎêòÎ©¥, nodeÏóê ÏÑ§ÏπòÎêú punycodeÎ•º ÏÇ¨Ïö©ÌïòÍ≤å ÎêòÎØÄÎ°ú
        ÎßåÏùº punycodeÍ∞Ä ÏÑ§ÏπòÎêòÏñ¥ ÏûàÏßÄ ÏïäÎã§Î©¥ Ï∂îÍ∞ÄÏ†ÅÏúºÎ°ú npm install punycode --saveÎ•º Ïã§Ìñâ

    • Îß§Î≤à ÏàòÏ†ïÌïòÍ∏∞ Í∑ÄÏ∞ÆÎã§Î©¥ postinstall Ïä§ÌÅ¨Î¶ΩÌä∏Î•º ÌôúÏö©ÌïòÏó¨ ÏûêÎèôÌôîÌïòÎ©¥ Îê® (ÏïÑÎûò ÏÑ§Î™Ö Ï∞∏Í≥†)

How I Got Resolved

Í≤∞Î°†ÏùÄ Í≤∞Î°†Ïù¥Í≥†, Î™®ÎëêÍ∞Ä ÏúÑÏóêÏÑú Ïñ∏Í∏âÌïú Ìå®ÌÇ§ÏßÄÏóê ÎåÄÌï¥ Î¨∏Ï†úÍ∞Ä ÏÉùÍ∏∞ÏßÄÎäî ÏïäÏùÑ Í≤ÉÏù¥Îã§.
Îî∞ÎùºÏÑú ÎÇ¥Í∞Ä Ïñ¥ÎñªÍ≤å Î¨∏Ï†úÎ•º Ìï¥Í≤∞ÌñàÎäîÏßÄÏóê ÎåÄÌïú Í≥ºÏ†ïÏùÑ ÏùòÏãùÏùò ÌùêÎ¶ÑÎåÄÎ°ú Ï†ÅÏñ¥Î≥¥ÏïòÎã§.

Check Status

ÏùºÎã® ÏÇ¨Ïö© Ï§ëÏù∏ Node Î≤ÑÏ†ÑÏùÑ ÌôïÏù∏Ìï¥Î≥¥ÏïòÎçò Í±∏Î°ú Í∏∞ÏñµÌïúÎã§.

Î≤ÑÏ†ÑÏùÑ 20ÏúºÎ°ú ÎÇÆÏ∂∞ÎèÑ ÏïÑÎßà Ìï¥Í≤∞ÏùÄ ÎêòÍ≤†ÏßÄÎßå, ÎÇÆÏ∂îÎäî Í±¥ Ïô†ÏßÄ ÏûêÏ°¥Ïã¨Ïù¥ ÌóàÎùΩ ÏïàÌïòÎäîÍ±∏~
(ÏùÄ ÏïÑÎãàÍ≥† Í∑∏ÎÉ• Node.jsÏóê Í¥ÄÌïú ÏßÄÏãùÏù¥ ÏóÜÏñ¥ÏÑú Î≤ÑÏ†ÑÎ≥Ñ Ï∞®Ïù¥Î•º Î™®Î•¥Í∏∞ ÎïåÎ¨∏Ïóê ÏµúÏã†Ïù¥ ÏµúÏÑ†Ïù¥ÎùºÍ≥† ÏÉùÍ∞ÅÌñàÏùå)

punycode vs. punycode/

Íµ¨Í∏ÄÏóê ‚Äúnpm punycode deprication‚Äù Îî∞ÏúÑÎ°ú Í≤ÄÏÉâÌï¥ÏÑú Ïù¥Í≤ÉÏ†ÄÍ≤É ÏÇ¥Ìé¥Î≥¥Îãà, Í≤∞Íµ≠ punycodeÎ•º ÏÇ¨Ïö©ÌïòÎäî Ìå®ÌÇ§ÏßÄÏóêÏÑú punycodeÎ•º Î∂àÎü¨Ïò§Îäî ÏΩîÎìúÎ•º ÏµúÏã†ÌôîÌïòÏßÄ ÏïäÏïÑÏÑú Î∞úÏÉùÌïòÎäî Î¨∏Ï†úÏòÄÎã§.

Í∑∏ÎãàÍπå, ÎåÄÏ∂© Î≠ê punycode ÍπÉÌóô Î¶¨ÎìúÎØ∏[2:1]Î•º ÏùΩÏñ¥Î≥¥Î©¥

  1. punycodeÎ•º ÏÑ§ÏπòÌïòÍ≥†
  2. require('punycode')Í∞Ä ÏïÑÎãå require('punycode/')Î°ú Î∂àÎü¨ÏôÄÏïº ÌïúÎã§Îäî Í≤É Í∞ôÎã§.

ÎåÄÏ≤¥ ÎëòÏù¥ Î≠êÍ∞Ä Îã§Î•∏ÏßÄ Î™®Î•¥Í≤†ÏßÄÎßå, Î≠ê Í∑∏ÎÉ• ÌååÏù¥Ïç¨Ïóê ÎπÑÏú†ÌïòÎ©¥ from .utils import * Îûë from utils import * ÏÇ¨Ïù¥Ïùò Í∞ÑÍ∑π Ï†ïÎèÑ ÏïÑÎãêÍπåÌïòÍ≥† Ï†ÅÎãπÌûà ÎÑòÏñ¥Í∞ê.^^

punycode dependency

ÏïÑÎ¨¥Ìäº Í∑∏Îü¨Ìïú Ïù¥Ïú†Î°ú punycodeÎ•º ÏÇ¨Ïö©ÌïòÎäî Î™®ÎìàÏùÑ Î™®Îëê Ï∞æÍ∏∞Î°ú ÌïúÎã§.
Î∏îÎ°úÍ∑∏ Î£®Ìä∏ ÎîîÎ†âÌÜ†Î¶¨Î°ú Í∞ÄÏÑú npm ls punycodeÎ°ú punycodeÏùò ÏÉÅÏÜç Ïó¨Î∂ÄÎ•º Ï∞æÏïÑÎ≥¥Ïûê.

ÎåÄÏ∂© Ïù¥Îü∞ Í≤∞Í≥ºÍ∞Ä Îú¨Îã§. (Í∏∞ÏñµÏù¥ Í∞ÄÎ¨ºÍ∞ÄÎ¨ºÌï¥ÏÑú Î≤ÑÏ†ÑÏùÄ Ïú†Ï∂îÌï¥ÏÑú Ï†ÅÏùÄ Í≤É)

Î≥¥Îã§ÏãúÌîº punycodeÎ•º Ïì∞Îäî uri-jsÎ•º Ïì∞Îäî ajvÎ•º Ïì∞Îäî eslintÎ•º Ïì∞Îäî hexo-generator-searchdb-customÏù¥ Î¨∏Ï†úÏù∏ Í±∏Î°ú ÌôïÏù∏ÎêòÏóàÎã§. „Öã„Öã

Ïïà Í∑∏ÎûòÎèÑ Íµ¨Í∏ÄÎßÅÌï† Îïå eslint, ajv, uri-js Ìå®ÌÇ§ÏßÄ Í¥ÄÎ†® Ïù¥ÏäàÍ∞Ä ÏûêÏ£º ÎÇòÏôîÎçò Í≤ÉÏù¥ ÏÉùÍ∞ÅÎÇòÏÑú, Ïù¥ ÏÑ∏ Í∞úÏùò Ìå®ÌÇ§ÏßÄÎèÑ ÎßàÏ∞¨Í∞ÄÏßÄÎ°ú npm ls [Ìå®ÌÇ§ÏßÄÎ™Ö] Î™ÖÎ†πÏñ¥Î°ú ÌôïÏù∏Ìï¥Î≥¥ÏïòÎã§.

Í≤∞Í≥ºÏ†ÅÏúºÎ°ú Îëê Ìå®ÌÇ§ÏßÄÏóêÏÑú Íµ¨Î≤ÑÏ†Ñ eslintÎ•º ÏÇ¨Ïö©ÌïòÎäî Í±∏Î°ú ÌôïÏù∏ÎêòÏóàÎã§.

  • hexo-generator-searchdb-custom
  • hexo-generator-sitemap-custom

Fix (1)

Ï≤òÏùåÏóêÎäî Ïù¥ Ìå®ÌÇ§ÏßÄÎì§Ïùò Î≤ÑÏ†ÑÏùÑ ÏµúÏã†ÏúºÎ°ú ÏóÖÎç∞Ïù¥Ìä∏ÌïòÎ©¥ ÎêòÍ≤†ÏßÄ Ïã∂Ïñ¥ÏÑú Í∞Å Ìå®ÌÇ§ÏßÄÏùò package.jsonÏùÑ Ïó¥Ïñ¥Î≥¥ÏïòÎäîÎç∞, Îëò Îã§ eslintÍ∞Ä devDependenciesÎ°ú ÏÑ§Ï†ïÎêú ÏºÄÏù¥Ïä§ÏòÄÎã§.

Îëê Ìå®ÌÇ§ÏßÄ Ïù¥Î¶ÑÏóêÏÑú ÏßêÏûëÎêòÍ≤†ÏßÄÎßå, Îëò Îã§ Í∏∞Ï°¥Ïùò ÌîåÎü¨Í∑∏Ïù∏ÏùÑ Î°úÏª¨ÏóêÏÑú Ïª§Ïä§ÌÖÄÌïú ÌîåÎü¨Í∑∏Ïù∏Ïù¥ÏóàÎã§. Í∏∞Ï°¥ Ìå®ÌÇ§ÏßÄÎ•º Ï†ÑÏ≤¥Ï†ÅÏúºÎ°ú Í±∞Ïùò Îã§ Í≥†Ï≥êÏïº Ìï¥ÏÑú Í∑∏ÎÉ• Î°úÏª¨Î°ú Î≥µÏ†úÌïú Îí§ ÏàòÏ†ïÌïòÏó¨ ÏïÑÎûòÏôÄ Í∞ôÏù¥ ÏÇ¨Ïö©ÌñàÎäîÎç∞ Ïù¥Í≤å Î¨∏Ï†úÏòÄÎã§.

Ïù¥Ïú†Îäî Î™®Î•¥Í≤†ÏúºÎÇò Ïù¥Î†áÍ≤å ÏßÅÏ†ë ÎßåÎì† Î°úÏª¨ Ìå®ÌÇ§ÏßÄÎ•º ÏÇ¨Ïö©Ìï† ÎïåÎäî devDependenciesÍπåÏßÄ Ìï®Íªò ÏÑ§ÏπòÎêòÏóàÎã§.

  • npm installÏùò --production ÏòµÏÖòÏù¥ Ï†ÅÏö©ÎêòÏßÄ ÏïäÎäî Í≤ÉÏúºÎ°ú Ï∂îÏ†ï
  • Íµ¨Í∏ÄÎßÅÌï¥ÎèÑ Ïù¥Ïú†Î•º Î™ª Ï∞æÏïÑÏÑú Ìè¨Í∏∞

Ïñ¥ÏßúÌîº Í∞úÎ∞úÏùò Ìé∏ÏùòÎ•º ÏúÑÌï¥ Í∏∞Ï°¥ Ìå®ÌÇ§ÏßÄÎ•º ÏàòÏ†ïÌïú Í≤ÉÏóê Î∂àÍ≥ºÌï¥ÏÑú devDependenciesÍ∞Ä ÌïÑÏöî ÏóÜÏóàÎã§.
Í∑∏ÎûòÏÑú Í∑∏ÎÉ• Îëê Ìå®ÌÇ§ÏßÄÏùò package.jsonÏóêÏÑú devDependencies Î∂ÄÎ∂ÑÏùÑ Î™®Îëê ÏÇ≠Ï†úÌïòÍ≥† ÏïÑÎûòÏùò ÏΩîÎìúÎ°ú Ìå®ÌÇ§ÏßÄÎì§ÏùÑ Ïû¨ÏÑ§ÏπòÌñàÎã§.

Fix (2)

Í∑∏ ÎïåÎäî Ìï¥Í≤∞Îê† Ï§Ñ ÏïåÏïòÎäîÎç∞‚Ä¶ Warning Îòê Îú®Îäî Í±∏ Î≥¥Í≥† ÏßÑÏã¨‚Ä¶ ÎÖ∏Ìä∏Î∂Å ÎçòÏ†∏Î≤ÑÎ¶¥ Îªî Ïó¨Í∏∞ÍπåÏßÄ Ïò§Îäî Îç∞Ïóê Ïù¥ÌãÄÏù¥ÎÇò Í±∏Î†∏Í∏∞ ÎïåÎß§‚Ä¶

Í∑∏ÎûòÏÑú Í∑∏ÎÉ• ÎßàÏùåÏùÑ ÎπÑÏö∞Í≥† find Î™ÖÎ†πÏñ¥Î°ú punycodeÎ•º ÏÇ¨Ïö©ÌïòÎäî js ÌååÏùºÏùÑ Î™®Îëê Ï∞æÍ∏∞Î°ú ÌñàÎã§.
Ï¢Ä Î¨¥ÏãùÌïòÍ∏¥ ÌïúÎç∞, Î≥ÑÎã§Î•∏ Î∞©Î≤ïÏùÑ Î™®Î•¥Í≤†Ïñ¥ÏÑú Í∑∏ÎÉ• Ïù¥Î†áÍ≤å ÌñàÏùå„Öé„Öé

Í≤∞Í≥ºÍ∞Ä ÍµâÏû•Ìûà ÎßéÏù¥ ÎÇòÏò§ÎäîÎç∞, Í∑∏ Ï§ëÏóê Ïù¥Îü∞ Í≤å ÏûàÏóàÎã§:
./hexo-renderer-markdown-it/node_modules/markdown-it/lib/index.js: var punycode = require('punycode');

ÏùºÎã® ÌïòÎÇòÎùºÎèÑ Ï∞æÏïòÏúºÎãà, Ïù¥ ÌååÏùºÎ∂ÄÌÑ∞ ÌïòÎÇòÏî© ÏàòÏ†ïÌï¥Î≥¥ÏûêÎäî ÎßàÏùåÏúºÎ°ú Ìï¥Îãπ ÌååÏùºÏùÑ Ïó¥Ïñ¥Î≥¥ÏïòÎã§.

Î≥¥ÎãàÍπê, hexo-renderer-markdown-it ÌîåÎü¨Í∑∏Ïù∏ÏóêÏÑú markdown-it@13.0.2Î•º ÏÇ¨Ïö©ÌïòÍ≥† ÏûàÎäîÎç∞, Ïù¥ Î≤ÑÏ†ÑÏùò lib/index.jsÏóêÏÑú punycodeÎ•º ÏòàÏ†Ñ Î∞©ÏãùÏúºÎ°ú Î∂àÎü¨Ïò§Í≥† ÏûàÏóàÎã§.

Í∑∏ÎûòÏÑú Í∑∏ÎÉ• Ïä¨ÎûòÏãú ÌïòÎÇò Ï∂îÍ∞ÄÌï¥Ï£ºÍ≥† Ï†ÄÏû•ÌïòÍ∏∞Îßå ÌñàÎã§.

Í∑∏Î¶¨Í≥† Îã§Ïãú Ìïú Î≤à hexo server -oÎ•º Ïã§ÌñâÌï¥Î≥¥Îãà Ïù¥Î≤àÏóî punycodeÍ∞Ä ÏÑ§ÏπòÎêòÏñ¥ ÏûàÏßÄ ÏïäÎã§Îäî Î¨∏Íµ¨Í∞Ä Îñ¥Îã§.
Ïù¥Îäî punycode/Î°ú Î∂àÎü¨Ïò§Îäî Î∞©ÏãùÏù¥ node_modulesÏóê ÏÑ§ÏπòÎêú punycodeÎ•º ÏÇ¨Ïö©ÌïòÍ≤å ÎêòÍ∏∞ ÎïåÎ¨∏Ïù∏ Í±∏Î°ú Î≥¥Ïù∏Îã§.

Í∞ÄÎ≥çÍ≤å npm i punycode --saveÎ°ú Î∏îÎ°úÍ∑∏ Î£®Ìä∏Ïóê punycodeÎ•º ÏÑ§ÏπòÌïú ÌõÑ Îã§Ïãú ÏÑúÎ≤ÑÎ•º Ïã§ÌñâÌï¥Î≥¥Îãà ÎìúÎîîÏñ¥ DeprecationWarningÏù¥ Îú®ÏßÄ ÏïäÏïòÎã§.

ÏôÄ! Îã§Ìñâ! Ïù¥Ï†ú ÎÖ∏Ìä∏Î∂ÅÏùÑ ÎçòÏßÄÏßÄ ÏïäÏïÑÎèÑ ÎêúÎã§!

Postinstall Script

Í∑∏Îü∞Îç∞, Ïù¥Î†áÍ≤å Îß§Î≤à ÏàòÏ†ïÌïòÍ∏∞ Í∑ÄÏ∞ÆÍ∏∞ÎèÑ ÌïòÍ≥† node_modulesÎ•º ÏßÅÏ†ë Í±¥ÎìúÎ¶¨Îäî Í≤å ÎßûÎÇò Ïã∂Í∏∞ÎèÑ Ìï¥ÏÑú Ï¢Ä Í≤ÄÏÉâÌï¥Î≥¥ÎãàÍπå Î∞îÎ°ú postinstall Ïä§ÌÅ¨Î¶ΩÌä∏Î•º ÌôúÏö©Î≤ïÏù¥ ÎÇòÏò§ÎçîÎùº.

Î∞©Î≤ïÏùÄ ÏÉÅÎãπÌûà Í∞ÑÎã®ÌïòÎã§.

  1. patch-package Ìå®ÌÇ§ÏßÄ ÏÑ§Ïπò

  2. node_modules ÏïàÏóêÏÑú ÏàòÏ†ïÌïòÍ≥† Ïã∂ÏùÄ ÌååÏùºÏùÑ Ï∞æÏïÑÏÑú ÏàòÏ†ï

    • Ïù¥ÎØ∏ ÏàòÏ†ïÎêòÏñ¥ ÏûàÏúºÎãà ÏÉùÎûµ

  3. package.jsonÏóê postinstall Ïä§ÌÅ¨Î¶ΩÌä∏ Ï∂îÍ∞Ä

  4. ÏàòÏ†ïÎêú ÌååÏùºÏùÑ Ìå®ÏπòÎ°ú Ï†ÄÏû•

    Ï£ºÏùò) Ïó¨Í∏∞ÏÑúÎäî Ìå®ÌÇ§ÏßÄ ÏÜç Ìå®ÌÇ§ÏßÄÎ•º ÏàòÏ†ïÌñàÍ∏∞ ÎïåÎ¨∏Ïóê
    npx patch-package hexo-renderer-markdown-itÏúºÎ°ú Ïã§ÌñâÌïòÎ©¥ Ìï¥Îãπ Ìå®ÌÇ§ÏßÄÏóêÏÑú Î∞îÎÄê Í≤å ÏïÑÎ¨¥ Í≤ÉÎèÑ ÏóÜÎã§Îäî Î©îÏãúÏßÄÍ∞Ä Îú¨Îã§.

    Îî∞ÎùºÏÑú npx patch-package hexo-renderer-markdown-it/markdown-itÏúºÎ°ú Ïã§ÌñâÌï¥Ïïº ÌïúÎã§.

  5. ÎÅù!

    • /patches ÎîîÎ†âÌÜ†Î¶¨Í∞Ä ÏÉùÏÑ±ÎêòÍ≥† Í∑∏ ÏïàÏóê Ìå®Ïπò ÌååÏùºÏù¥ ÏÉùÏÑ±ÎêúÎã§.
    • npm install Ïãú ÏûêÎèôÏúºÎ°ú Ìï¥Îãπ Ìè¥ÎçîÏùò Ìå®ÏπòÎì§Ïù¥ Ï†ÅÏö©ÎêòÎØÄÎ°ú Îçî Ïù¥ÏÉÅ ÏßÅÏ†ë ÏàòÏ†ïÌï† ÌïÑÏöîÍ∞Ä ÏóÜÎã§.

P.S.

  • Í≥†Ïûë DeprecationWarning ÌïòÎÇò ÎïåÎ¨∏Ïóê Ïù¥Î†áÍ≤å Í≥†ÏÉùÏùÑ ÌïòÎã§Îãà „Ö†„Ö† ÎÇò ÏßÑÏßú Node.js Ï™ΩÏùÄ ÌååÏßÄ ÎßêÏïÑÏïºÏßÄü´†
  • ÎÇòÏ§ëÏóê markdown-it Î≤ÑÏ†ÑÏùÑ Ïò¨Î¶¨Îäî ‚Äúoverrides‚Äù Î∞©ÏãùÎèÑ ÏãúÎèÑÌï¥Î¥§ÎäîÎç∞ Ïïà ÎêêÏùå. Í∑ºÎç∞ Ïò§Î≤ÑÎùºÏù¥Îî©ÏùÄ Ï†ïÎßê Ïâ¨Ïö∞Îãà ÏãúÎèÑÌï¥Î≥¥Î©¥ Ï¢ãÏùÑ ÎìØ[3].
